title: So why does TFT still have ranked even though its nothing but pure rng?
body:
I have 0 idea if this has been asked before (yes I searched the forums and found nothing)

But to me it is a legit question

I don't understand why Riot lets this game mode have ranked when it has nothing to do with skill

it is just Pure RNG

1) There is never any guarantee what champions are available in the all pick
2) There is never any guarantee what champions are available in your store
3) There is never any guarantee you will get items
4) There is never any guarantee that you will be able to upgrade the champions you have; because of the store
5) Matches can often be bs. You could fight the same person twice, with 0 change in your champions, items and positions. Lose the first fight and win the second. (or vice versa)

I know Riot tried to fix the items to some extent but it didn't work. If anything it is now worse than before. Players can still get absolutely nothing for items while others get 10 in the same time period.

And adding new champions into the mix just further complicates and pollutes the already nonsensical store/pick; because it just got that much harder to get champions you need.

Also I am almost 100% convinced that after a certain level, some champions get removed from your store rotation, making the above even harder. Or if they aren't removed, they become that much harder to get since they don't show up as often because you are mainly seeing higher rarity champions.

If it was pure RNG, than players wouldn't be able to climb to grandmaster / challenger by winning consistently ;). **Yes** there is certainly *more* RNG in TFT than say, League, but its not *all* RNG, if that makes sense. There is still a level of skill, knowledge, and execution required by TFT which allows for skilled players to climb a ranked ladder :). The same way that there are highly skilled poker players in a game where its really luck of the draw in how good your hand is.

Incorrect. It actually is 100% possible for one player to get better results than another in a pure RNG system. That's the _point_ of an RNG system: to determine a (randomly-chosen) winner. Outliers become _less likely_ with bigger sample size, but that's statistics, not a guarantee.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=RaE1aOE7,discussion-id=EF5TA1Iv,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2019-08-20T00:05:26.442+0000)

Yes but if you are consistently getting better results then either you are the luckiest person alive, or there is something that you know that others don't. In a pure RNG system yes, one random dude will get better results always. But then comes the next match and the next and the next. Those who rely purely on luck will eventually be at the bottom but those who can manipulate the rng will climb. 

TFT is no different, how well can you adapt vs your competition is a huge deciding factor in how well you place. Yes you might not win every single match but you don't need to place 1st in order to "win" even a 4th place finish can be considered a win if your starting "hand" was atrocious.

But the statement that

is logically and mathematically incorrect.

I think alot of peoples issues with TFT having a ranked mode, is that it has a TON of RNG, meanwhile you guys refuse to put in a ranked mode for ARAM due to the RNG, even though with bans and rerolls there'd arguably be less RNG in ranked ARAM than TFT, ARAM also doesn't have very expensive gacha boxes tied into it.

This is untrue. BECAUSE it's RNG, it's possible to estimate the statistically most viable play for any situation. It won't always win (because RNG), but it will most often. Kind of like Blackjack.

Making the correct plays in Blackjack isn't a skill. Evaluating the correct play in TFT is a bit more complicated, but I wouldn't consider it a skill. A robot could do it. And, apparently, some people can already consistently do it as well.

The only skill in this game is dealing with what the 90% RNG gives you.

Dealing with what items the RNG gave you.
What champs the RNG gave you.
What lineup the RNG gave you.
What the RNG gave everyone else.

It ALL plays around RNG, and you CAN NEVER hope to make a balanced ranked mode around that.

Every single game is made of 3 players that hit the RNG lottery at the start of the game that shit on everyone else, and then the rest of the players. And because you will not see shards of a champ that someone else is also building, it makes building a good comp hard if you are on the bottom...and everyone abuses the same broken comps every game. Unless you hit the RNG lottery (look, theres the RNG again) late game and have inted the whole time to save your gold, you will have no shot at first or second place. Maybe 5th, but you lose LP anyways after crawling out of the bottom with the random team you have to put together. 




OH I forgot, what bugs you encounter is RNG too, because there's plenty of those but I guess rolling out ranked and then having a party to celebrate was more important than fixing the game.
